answers.answer: 133mg/dl (US measurement) = 7.4mmol/l (UK measurement).In the UK a measurement of 6.9mmol/l and above is considered as diabetes.These levels are not extremely high, but they fall into the diabetic category and that is why the doctor wants to check your daughter's fasting sugar levels.Best wishes

question: My daughter ( 7 yrs old) had her blood sugar tested at a dr appointment yesterday. It was taken about 4 hours after eating. It came back at 133. The dr wants to do a fasting check on her. Are her levels high?
title: blood sugar
